intro: Tarenna mollis, commonly known as the slender tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Tarenna mollis is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
